content: There are many examples of powerful individuals being put in positions where they are vulnerable to being overpowered by everyday people. One famous example is the assassination of Julius Caesar by a group of senators, who were able to take advantage of a moment when Caesar was off guard to strike. In more recent history, there have been numerous instances of heads of state or other powerful individuals being taken into custody by law enforcement officers or other members of the public. For example, former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein was captured by U.S. soldiers in 2003, and former Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi was killed by rebels in 2011. These incidents demonstrate the way in which even the most powerful individuals can be brought down by ordinary people in the right circumstances.
